definition: to express/to give expression to/variant of 紓|纾[shu1]/to relieve
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs

sentences.english: Jiu Ge is a group of lyric poetry with a novel way of composition.
sentences.chinese: 《九歌》是一组体制独特的抒情诗。

sentences.english: This is a good example of his lyric poetry.
sentences.chinese: 这首诗是他抒情诗的范例。

sentences.english: The lyrics of Shakespeare exalted the audience.
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚的抒情诗激发了听众的想像力。

sentences.english: Snow Lai another lyric poetry has the feeling of the imagination and beautiful of brilliancy with the result that.
sentences.chinese: 雪莱另一类抒情诗具有辉煌的想象和优美的情致。

sentences.english: Alden Soup boiled with lima beans looks like a lyric for autumn.
sentences.chinese: 用青豆熬成的爱尔登汤，有如一篇科天的抒情诗。

sentences.english: A glance can be a dangerous thing in the world of Latin lyric poetry.
sentences.chinese: 在拉丁文的抒情诗中，无意的一瞥可能是危险的。

sentences.english: Sexuality is the lyricism of the masses .
But the art of his lyrics will endure.
sentences.chinese: 但他的抒情诗艺术将永世长存。

sentences.english: He's finished. He has completed this lyric poem.
sentences.chinese: 他已经结束了，已经完成了这首抒情诗。

sentences.english: He wrote lyric poems of his own in English, for he did not speak the Welsh language.
sentences.chinese: 他不会说威尔士语，所以用英语写抒情诗。

sentences.english: Mr. Wang Yilian edited Ar Zhong's Black Lyric Volume(about 150 pages).
sentences.chinese: 王一梁选编《阿钟黑色抒情诗卷》，约150页。

sentences.english: Burnside's intensely lyric poems occupy a borderland between two worlds.
sentences.chinese: 伯恩赛德感情强烈的抒情诗介于两个世界之间。

sentences.english: Lyrics and music are co-credited to both Bacharach and Costello.
sentences.chinese: 抒情诗和音乐共同计入巴哈拉赫和科斯特洛。

sentences.english: It sounds  more  a  lyric  than  a  song.
sentences.chinese: 它与其说是歌词，不如说是一首抒情诗。

sentences.english: Schubert set some of Goethe's lyrics to music.
sentences.chinese: 舒伯特把歌德的一些抒情诗谱成了歌曲。

definition: abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
Misty Poetry, a post-Cultural Revolution poetry movement
a poem/a composition in verse/fig. epic (compared with historical epic)/the biblical Book of Psalms
a pre-Tang Dynasty genre of poetry, relatively free in form, usually having four, five, six or seven characters per line
